title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Railway Safety Act 2005 (Section 26)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Railway Safety Act 2005 (Section 26) 

Levy Order 2022.

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: 3. This order shall apply to the railway organisations set out in the Schedule
text_raw:
3. This order shall apply to the railway organisations set out in the Schedule 

to this Order (“relevant railway organisation”).
text_norm: 3 order shall apply railway organisation set schedule order ( relevant railway organisation )

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: 4. A railway organisation that is also heritage railway shall be exempt from
text_raw:
4. A railway organisation that is also heritage railway shall be exempt from 

payment of any levy to the Commission.
text_norm: 4 railway organisation also heritage railway shall exempt payment levy commission

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: 5. A levy is hereby imposed on each relevant railway organisation in respect
text_raw:
5. A levy is hereby imposed on each relevant railway organisation in respect 
of the levy year. The levy shall be in the amount set out in the Schedule to this 
Order.
text_norm: 5 levy hereby imposed relevant railway organisation respect levy year levy shall amount set schedule order

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: The levy shall be payable in three equal installments (relevant period)
text_raw:
6. 

 The levy shall be payable in three equal installments (relevant period) 
within a period of fourteen days of being notified by the Commission that the 
levy is due for payment. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th April, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [194] 3
text_norm: 6 levy shall payable three equal installment (relevant period) within period fourteen day notified commission levy due payment notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 26th april 2022 194 3

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: 7. Monies raised by the Commission through imposition of this levy shall
text_raw:
7. Monies raised by the Commission through imposition of this levy shall 
be used for the purpose of meeting expenses properly incurred by the 
Commission in discharge of its functions under the Act.
text_norm: 7 monies raised commission imposition levy shall used purpose meeting expense properly incurred commission discharge function act

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 5 is not paid within
text_raw:
8. 

 Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 5 is not paid within 
a period of fourteen days of the time specified in Article 6 interest thereon shall 
accrue at the prescribed interest rate compounded monthly from the date such 
payment fell due until same is made. The prescribed interest rate shall be a rate 
2% per annum above the Euribor rate.
text_norm: 8 amount falling paid article 5 paid within period fourteen day time specified article 6 interest thereon shall accrue prescribed interest rate compounded monthly date payment fell due made prescribed interest rate shall rate 2 per annum euribor rate

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: 9. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank
text_raw:
9. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank 
transfer or equivalent instantaneous transfer of funds to the bank account 
specified by the Commission. 

(2) Relevant railway organisations shall notify the Commission as soon as 
payment has been made, indicating the date on which payment was made and 
the name of the bank effecting the payment. 

(3) The Commission shall make a request for payment in accordance with 

section 5 of this Order to the relevant railway organisations.
text_norm: 9 (1) payment shall made euro due date direct bank transfer equivalent instantaneous transfer fund bank account specified commission (2) relevant railway organisation shall notify commission soon payment made indicating date payment made name bank effecting payment (3) commission shall make request payment accordance section 5 order relevant railway organisation

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: 10. The total amount of levy imposed on relevant railway organisations in
text_raw:
10. The total amount of levy imposed on relevant railway organisations in 
any year shall not exceed the Commission’s reasonable estimate of the expenses 
that it will incur in that year in the discharge of its functions under the Act 
excluding- 

(a) 

(b) 

the amount of any grants received out of monies duly provided 
under the Act, and 

any other payment received by the Commission to offset expenses 
incurred in the discharge of its functions.
text_norm: 10 total amount levy imposed relevant railway organisation year shall exceed commission reasonable estimate expense incur year discharge function act excluding- (a) (b) amount grant received monies duly provided act payment received commission offset expense incurred discharge function

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: 11. (1) Where the gross income received by the Commission in each
text_raw:
11. (1) Where the gross income received by the Commission in each 
financial year exceeds the gross expenditure incurred in the administration of its 
office in that year, under section 26(6) of the Act, the Minister may, with the 
consent of the Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform, direct the 
Commission to pay into the Exchequer, such sums as he or she may specify, 
being a sum that represents such surplus. 

(2) Where the Minister does not make such a direction, any surplus of 
Commission income over expenses in a particular year shall be deemed to be 
monies derived through the imposition of a levy and shall either- 

(a) be retained by the Commission to be offset against levy 

obligations for the subsequent year, or 

(b) be refunded proportionately to the relevant railway organisations 

on whom the levy concerned was imposed.

title: it by section 26 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005), and with the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The purpose of this Order is to introduce a levy, in accordance with section 26 
of the Railway Safety Act 2005, in order to meet the expenditure properly 
incurred by the Commission for Railway Regulation in the discharge of its 
functions. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [194]
